messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]CHEMISTRY
messages.msgSnippet: ... I just remembered a fun thing we did. You take a basic muffin recipe and play around with it. You make lots of different versions of the batter. Each time,
messages.messageBody:
>
>>:) That is a chemistry question!! Science in
>life...WHY? The portions were too small is a
>hypothesis. So try bigger portions. WHY does this work
>better? or does it? What happens if you substitute
>something for something else? WHY?<<


I just remembered a fun thing we did. You take a basic muffin recipe and
play around with it. You make lots of different versions of the batter. Each
time, you leave out a different ingredient and see what happens when you
bake them. It becomes very obvious what sugar, eggs, flour or baking soda do
for a recipe.

~Mary
